intro: Perityle cochisensis, commonly known as the Cochise perityle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Perityle cochisensis produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
